fusion: I use it for almost every 3D model I've made, but I haven't had the opportunity to use the other tools Fusion offers for production
neovim: After use VScode at least for a year, I found Neovim as my preferred code editor at the moment.
web: I think I'm having a Dunnig-Kruger effect in the creation of web pages, but you can evaluate with this page and others I've created if my work is good or not.
git: I control git from the terminal with GitHub as a remote repository.
rust: I love rust. Everything crashes, but that is the most important part of programming: Knowing what is wrong or could go wrong in the future and solve it. That is why I'm trying to migrate from C to Rust. However, it's a long and, at the moment, strange path for me.
linux: I used Arch as my principle distribution of linux for 2 year. However I started to use Fusion 360, so I couldn't continue with it. But I miss Linux, so at the moment I'm saving money to buy 1TB drive to dual-boot my PC
Microchip: I use this sofware to program in C because it speeds up and saves me a lot of work. But I'm trying to change that, programming without microchip studio and using instead the terminal with Neovim.
Kicad: All my projects were created with Kicad. I'm improving in this area but at the moment I'm able to create simple PCB circuits.

aboutMe.description:
I'm a very appassionate person, striving to improve day by day to make the world an easier place to live through mechatronics and engineering. I would be delighted to work with people that share the same passion for this stuff.
 I enjoy programming, spending time with friends, 3D modeling, reding and learning.

projects.name: Chess Clock
projects.description: A simple chess clock ready to play

projects.name: Climb
projects.description: A prototype in progress to simulate biclycle routes
